title: Allow injection of beans created in the `test` suite in `@QuarkusInterationTest`s

labels.name: triage/wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

body:
### Description

 It is quite a handy tool for writing tests to be able to `@Inject` beans established within the `test` source-suite.

It makes sense that internal services, from `main` should not be available to tests running as `@QuarkusIntegrationTest`, but these beans that only use resources created from within the `test` suite should be able to be wired in.

### Implementation ideas

If the utilities that discover beans were flexible enough, we could create a new instance/ set of beans just for the `test` source set, and make that available to `@QuarkusIntegrationTest`s. This is probably wishful thinking though.

Maybe a new set of annotations; `@TestScoped`, `@TestInject`?
